Running slide 1...
==================================================
NOTE: Graphs will open in separate windows.
      Close graph windows to continue execution.
==================================================
Slide 1: Introduction to Probability
Based on: Jon Krohn's Machine Learning Foundations series
Lecturer: Dr. Yoram Segal
============================================================
=== Dice Probability Calculations ===
Probability for each outcome: 0.167
Probability of even number: 0.500
Probability of odd number: 0.500
Probability of number > 4: 0.333
=== Dice Probability Calculations ===
Probability for each outcome: 0.167
Probability of even number: 0.500
Probability of odd number: 0.500
Probability of number > 4: 0.333
Chart saved to: /home/ubuntu/probability_project/slide01/dice_probability_chart.png

=== Simulation of 1000 Dice Rolls ===
Simulation Results:
  1: 0.181 (theoretical: 0.167)
  2: 0.164 (theoretical: 0.167)
  3: 0.154 (theoretical: 0.167)
  4: 0.174 (theoretical: 0.167)
  5: 0.172 (theoretical: 0.167)
  6: 0.155 (theoretical: 0.167)
Simulation plot saved to: /home/ubuntu/probability_project/slide01/dice_simulation.png

=== Basic Probability Rules ===
P(even) + P(odd) = 0.500 + 0.500 = 1.000
P(not 6) = 1 - P(6) = 1 - 0.167 = 0.833
P(6|even) = 0.333

Slide 1 demonstration completed

Slide 1 completed successfully!
If graph windows are still open, please close them to continue.

============================================================

==================== Slide 2 ====================
Running slide 2...
==================================================
NOTE: Graphs will open in separate windows.
      Close graph windows to continue execution.
==================================================
Slide 2: Uniform Distribution
Lecturer: Dr. Yoram Segal
========================================
=== Generating 1000 samples from Uniform Distribution [0, 10] ===
Theoretical mean: 5.000
Empirical mean: 4.903
Theoretical variance: 8.333
Empirical variance: 8.526
=== Generating 1000 samples from Uniform Distribution [0, 10] ===
Theoretical mean: 5.000
Empirical mean: 4.903
Theoretical variance: 8.333
Empirical variance: 8.526
Plot saved to: /home/ubuntu/probability_project/slide02/uniform_distribution.png

=== Uniform Distribution Properties ===
Distribution Properties:
------------------------------------------------------------
Range           Mean     Variance   Std Dev  Description
------------------------------------------------------------
[ 0,  1]         0.5       0.08     0.29   Standard Uniform
[ 5, 15]        10.0       8.33     2.89   Uniform [5,15]
[-10, 10]         0.0      33.33     5.77   Symmetric Uniform
[ 0, 100]        50.0     833.33    28.87   Wide Range Uniform

Slide 2 demonstration completed
